page.title: 02Hangars at Cardington
page.content:
At the western edge of our block are the giant hangars at Cardington. They can be seen from miles around and are a very important reminder of the past. They are 800 feet long and nearly 180 feet high. Their width is 270 feet. The main doors have a weight of 940 tons. They run on rails and need an electric motor to open them.
The first one was put up in 1917, but made bigger when the second was brought from Norfolk and built in the late 1920s. It was then thought that Cardington would be the home of airship travel . The two giant airships the R100 and the R101 were kept there. The R101 was built by the Royal Airship Works.
The disasterous crash of the R101 ended a dream for many local people.
